snippet.title: Man denies teen's murder, sexual assault
snippet.content: A man has gone on trial accused of sexually assaulting a 16-year-old boy, strangling him and beating him with a toaster and rolling pin in a vacant Sydney house. Admen Terkamani, 24, has pleaded not guilty in the NSW Supreme Court to the murder and aggravated sexual assault of the teenager at a Fairfield East house on the evening of May 16, 2015. Opening the crown case to the jury on Monday, prosecutor Andrew Robinson alleged the boy was under the influence of ecstasy when Terkamani killed him. (C) AAP 2017
